item.title: Three Minute Thesis
item.description:
Here’s my attempt at explaining my research in three minutes. It’s anchored to the story of Jean-Dominuque Bauby, a French fashion editor who was left almost completely paralysed after suffering a severe stroke in 1995. He described his experience of living with locked-in syndrome in his 1997 memoir The Divingbell and the Butterfly.

I haven’t watched this. For all I know the sound cuts out after 5 seconds. All I can say is it was at least good enough to get a place in the final.

item.title: Participants wanted
item.description:
Currently recruiting stroke patients with persistent arm weakness for an online BCI study: flyer.

Participants Wanted

  • Share your ideas on our discussion page.
  • Share models and data
  • email us at reachingdatabase@gmail.com
